item.description:
Arrive at 9:30 and launch by 10:00 AM

Organizers: Mark Roberts, mroberts@CIA.com 401-533-1883 cell

Check RICKA Message Board for last minute cancellations: http://members.boardh...

Narrow River is open to major recreational boat traffic, and on this weekend it will be busy. We paddle staying to the sides to avoid the boats. All length boats are suitable. The paddle is scenic and fun ending at the mouth of the river on Narragansett Bay. We’ll stay awhile on the beach for lunch, snorkeling, and swimming. People can paddle back on their own when they’ve had enough. Arrive early to get a parking spot and avoid the boat traffic.

Bring a lunch, swim gear, beach towel.

Directions: Take 95 South to exit 9 (a left exit) towards Newport/S. County. Merge onto Rt. 4 South. Turn slight right onto Tower Hill Road. Turn left onto Bridgetown Road (at large tower). Turn slight right onto Middlebridge road. Approximately a mile and half-mile up on the left will be Pollock Street. Turn and follow to the parking area. N41 28.044 W071 27.013


Check RICKA for additional paddles scheduled
RICKA Schedule:
http://www.ricka-flat...

RICKA Blackstone Paddlers has additional free instruction and beginner paddles
Blackstone Valley Paddlers
http://www.ricka-flat...
item.how_to_find_us: Orange/Yellow Riot Voyager Kayak, shaved head
item.name: Narrow River, Narragansett RI
